column4: I read somewhere that it is bad style to log in as superuser, is this true?
Yes.  Use sudo for just about everything.
white=not selected, nothing interesting, star=newly available, updated, or something like that, green=installed.
so if you're a real fanatic you'd mark all upgrades of the white boxes with yellow stars and click apply ?
No, you use the option to automatically select all upgrades, then click apply.
?  I wouldn't say I'm a real fanatic either, just like to be up-to-date.
I do it via command line, but yes.
should I do it too or could my PC get slower from it?
Well, I don't really know enough about the inner workings of things to answer that intelligently, but I've seen no problem.
I don't think it matters.  I'm always running stuff.
What jamuraa said, then click Apply.
